page.title: 06Fenland Farming -Kirton Area
page.content: Crops grown in this area are used in many different ways. The sugar beet is made into sugar at a local factory. The vegetables go to the fresh market or to be frozen or canned. Some wheat is exported. There is no livestock because the land is too good for animals to graze on. The farmland in this area is very flat. As you look across the fields you can see long distances and there are few trees. The farmers do not like trees or bushes in their fields because they take up a lot of room and the soil is too expensive for that. However, they are planting trees in small spinnies and hedges to try and preserve some natural habitat.
